job description:
Responsibilities:
  • Develop and implement text mining methods and tools to analyze oncology EMR data, understanding cancer patient history and develop predictive models for patient clinical outcome.
  • Analyze high throughput genetic data including whole genome, whole exome, and genome-wide genotyping data. Integrative analysis of genetic data and clinical data to understand genetic risks, disease mechanisms, and drug response.
  • Develop and maintain collaborations both within the company and also with outside researchers in academia and industry.
Requirements:

Expertise in computational methods to analyze large-scale genetic and clinical data.
  • Prior experience analyzing electronic medical record or electronic health record data.
  • Prior experience analyzing cancer patient clinical and genetic data
  • A track record of leading biomedical projects using statistical or computational approaches
  • Outstanding programming skills in R, Perl, Python, and/or C++; Extensive experience in SQL
  • Strong knowledge of Unix shell scripting
  • Strong genomics and genetics background
  • Outstanding knowledge of public repositories of genetic, genomic, and biological data
  • Strong ability to collaborate with teams of research scientists, bioinformaticians, software developers, and external collaborators
Education:

PhD in bioinformatics, biomedical informatics, computer science, computational biology, genomics, genetics, or a related field.
